channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Staying away from family to keep residents safe
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

When Ms Siti Nadia checked into her Oakwood Premier hotel room in Shenton Way last week, it was like beginning a mini staycation in the heart of town.

item.title: Social help networks need digital solutions: Indranee
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Networks of social help will require new digital solutions in a post-Covid-19 Singapore, said Second Minister for Finance Indranee Rajah.

item.title: NTUC honours 29 organisations
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Cleaning staff at Copthorne King's Hotel used to take about two hours to clean and polish the glass panels at the hotel's lobby.

item.title: Swab tests: Ministry addresses issue of long bus queues at Khatib
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Pre-school staff who turned up hours ahead of their scheduled slots for Covid-19 swab tests caused long queues at Khatib MRT station on Friday, said the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF).

item.title: Ex-jockey sued too late - apex court reverses $886,000 award
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Retired top jockey Saimee Jumaat, who was awarded US$620,900 (S$886,000) in a High Court suit last year, saw it evaporate when Singapore's top court reversed the ruling because he had sued too late.

item.title: My body was a wreck, says Covid-19 patient
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

On his 15th day at Changi General Hospital (CGH) battling the coronavirus, Mr Andrew Phay woke up to news that he had low oxygen levels in his blood.

item.title: Man, 20, held over alleged murder of jogger
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A 20-year-old Singaporean man has been arrested over the suspected murder of a jogger in Punggol Field. He is expected to be charged with murder in court today.

item.title: Singapore reports 22nd Covid-19 death; 1,094 discharged
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A 67-year-old male Singaporean died on Friday from complications due to Covid-19 infection, bringing the total number of deaths here to 22.

item.title: DFS slashes prices to clear stock before exit
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Luxury travel retailer DFS has started to clear its stock before leaving Changi Airport next month. And the response to the slashed prices on the dedicated website has been overwhelming.

item.title: Coronavirus: 18 discharged despite testing positive as they cannot infect others: MOH
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A group of Covid-19 patients who were discharged from a community care facility yesterday despite testing positive are not infectious and do not pose a threat to the community, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: PM joins community leaders in virtual breaking of fast
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong having a date in an "e-buka puasa", or a virtual breaking of fast, yesterday evening, as he took part in an online dialogue with Malay-Muslim and community leaders.

item.title: Pre-schools make plans to ensure safety when kids return
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Preparations are under way at pre-schools to reopen their doors to pupils, even as around 30,000 staff, including administrative staff and teachers, undergo mandatory Covid-19 swab tests.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cinemas, clubs expect 'business as unusual' when they reopen
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Sitting apart from the person you go to the cinema with, or getting your temperature taken at the club entrance, could be the new normal once cinemas and nightclubs get the green light to reopen.

item.title: Coronavirus: Digital check-ins and lots of disinfecting as hotels gear up
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as hotels grapple with some of the worst occupancy rates in history, they know it cannot be business as usual when they are allowed to reopen. Concerns over coronavirus transmission mean learning to deliver hospitality despite minimising contact between visitors and staff, with a heightened focus on hygiene.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some help out by offering beds and meals for free
item.description:
May 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Several hotels have been putting their facilities to good use, offering beds and meals for free.
